alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued November 16 at 5:06AM PST until November 16 at 6:15AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM PST FOR RIVERSIDE COUNTY... At 505 AM PST, a dust channel was 11 miles east of Desert Center, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between Blythe and Desert Center. CA Route 177 between mile markers 2 and 26. This dust channel will remain over mainly rural areas of Riverside County. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
